intro: Indigastrum costatum subsp. costatum, commonly known as the coastal indigastrum, is a flowering plant native to specific coastal regions. It is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and small, clustered flowers that typically bloom in spring. The plant thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to salt spray and wind exposure. Its subspecies status highlights its distinct ecological niche within the genus Indigastrum. It plays a role in stabilizing coastal dunes and supporting local biodiversity.
